document.full_text: the mississippi river at cairo, illinois, had dropped about one foot by tuesday morning, eight hours after the government blew open a levee to relieve flooding in illinois and kentucky, a u.s. army corps of engineers spokesman said.
document.title: mississippi drops a foot within hours of levee detonation
lines_and_colors: the mississippi river at cairo, illinois, had dropped about one foot by tuesday morning, eight hours after the government blew open a levee to relieve flooding in illinois and kentucky, a u.s. army corps of engineers spokesman said.
